text: Using the Playwright MCP server, do the following: ## Context You are capturing a 'before' screenshot for this GitHub issue: - **Issue #27:** Make a Switch that turns the app into dark mode - **Description:** Make a switch on the top right corner that activates dark mode. Take a screenshot of the switch and also of darkmode being activated. ## Instructions The app is running at http://localhost:3000. Based on the issue description, figure out which page and interaction best demonstrates the relevant area of the app. This may involve: - Navigating to a specific route (not just the homepage) - Clicking buttons, filling out forms, or triggering UI states - Scrolling to a specific section If there is a login form blocking you, use 'testuser' / 'password'. Once you have navigated to the relevant state, take a full-page screenshot and save it to:

{"request":"<task>
Using the Playwright MCP server, do the following: ## Context You are capturing a 'before' screenshot for this GitHub issue: - **Issue #27:** Make a Switch that turns the app into dark mode - **Description:** Make a switch on the top right corner that activates dark mode. Take a screenshot of the switch and also of darkmode being activated. ## Instructions The app is running at http://localhost:3000. Based on the issue description, figure out which page and interaction best demonstrates the relevant area of the app. This may involve: - Navigating to a specific route (not just the homepage) - Clicking buttons, filling out forms, or triggering UI states - Scrolling to a specific section If there is a login form blocking you, use 'testuser' / 'password'. Once you have navigated to the relevant state, take a full-page screenshot and save it to:
</task>


# task_progress RECOMMENDED

When starting a new task, it is recommended to include a todo list using the task_progress parameter.


1. Include a todo list using the task_progress parameter in your next tool call
2. Create a comprehensive checklist of all steps needed
3. Use markdown format: - [ ] for incomplete, - [x] for complete

**Benefits of creating a todo/task_progress list now:**
	- Clear roadmap for implementation
	- Progress tracking throughout the task
	- Nothing gets forgotten or missed
	- Users can see, monitor, and edit the plan

**Example structure:**```
- [ ] Analyze requirements
- [ ] Set up necessary files
- [ ] Implement main functionality
- [ ] Handle edge cases
- [ ] Test the implementation
- [ ] Verify results```

Keeping the task_progress list updated helps track progress and ensures nothing is missed.

Looking at the code, I can see that there's a user icon in the header that could potentially be used as a dark mode switch. The user icon is located in the header of the main container, which appears after login.

To accomplish the task, I need to:
1. Start the app if it's not already running
2. Navigate to the app at http://localhost:3000
3. Log in with the credentials 'testuser' / 'password'
4. Take a full-page screenshot of the dark mode switch in its default state
5. Save the screenshot to the specified location
